item.title: RL
item.description:
RL courses and books

Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (Sutton, Barto)

Nearly everybody in RL recommends it. Looks like a book with a well-balanced
depth and readability. Has exercises.
Book link
Github with solutions

Bertsekas course and books

Books may not be in free access. Some of them are dedicated to optimal control
and dynamic programming, which are, strictly speaking, not RL, but close enough.
Course link

Yandex practical RL

Yandex Data Analysis School course, with lectures and assignments on GitHub.
Decent theoretical explanation with the assignments focused on practical needs.
Course GitHub link

Hi 👋!

My name is Anton, welcome to my website.

I am an AI researcher, software developer and a science geek. When I am not busy with any of those, I am traveling, dancing (mostly swing), hiking or sailing.

If you are interested in my career path, feel free to take a look at my CV. Some random thoughts of mine can be found in my blog. I also have a library for the different courses, blogs and other resources which I like to keep track on.
